bug.short_desc: Try to close window 1 when click on close in window 2 (pop ups the are you sure to close all tabs question)

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Eg> when a webpage popups a new window and you close it, it closes, but your original window ask you if you are sure if you want to close your window with many tabs opened.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. open many tabs in a window 2. open a new window 3. close the new window
Expected Results: just close the window where you click close, not other mozilla windows
windows 7 32bits firefox 4.0 summer mozilla theme Plugins: Web developer toolbar google toolbar firebug firecookies awsome screenshot clear cache 1.2 download helper flashbug toogle webdeveloper toolbar

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
I have tried to reproduce this, but I can't.
How do you close your second window? By pressing Ctrl-W, by left clicking X, by ...?
Are you able to reproduce this bug with a clean profile? https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic%20Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile

It happens by left clicking the X button of my 2nd window, then my 1st window ask me if Im sure to close the window with many tabs(1st. window).
With a clean profile I cannot reproduce this bug.

OK, then it sounds like an add-on problem.
Try to start your Firefox in Safe Mode and see if that also inhibits the bug: https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
If so, then you may start the add-ons one by one until the bug shows up again and you will find the offending add-on.
